snippet: Ban Ki-moon made his strongest criticism to date of how the Buddhist-majority country has handled the growing problem of mob violence against Muslims.
abstract: United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-moon warns Myanmar government of 'dangerous polarization' between Buddhists and Muslims, urging leaders of Buddhist-majority country to resolve citizenship for nearly one million stateless Muslims near border with Bangladesh.
lead_paragraph: Ban Ki-moon made his strongest criticism to date of how the Buddhist-majority country has handled the growing problem of mob violence against Muslims.

headline.main: U.N. Secretary General Warns Myanmar on Religious Violence
headline.print_headline:
U.N. Leader Warns Myanmar
About Religious ‘Polarization’
